The small dose of saline makes the flavors pop and ties the room together.Created by barkeep Dave Purcell, the Black Julep is available at Melrose Umbrella Co. in Los Angeles—which is not really an umbrella shop, but one of the better cocktail bars in town. If you're in the neighborhood, it's worth a visit. If you're not, well, that's what recipes are for. Mix up one of these for the Kentucky Derby, or anytime you find yourself with a well-stocked home bar and a thirst for something different.

instructions.description: Shake all liquid ingredients with ice, then strain into an Old-Fashioned glass.
Fill glass with crushed ice, creating a mound of ice on top of the drink.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: White Negroni
description: The White Negroni is a riff on the classic Negroni that... is white/clear instead of red. Hence the name. But that lighter hue comes via some ingredient swaps. The base is still gin, but from there, Campari and sweet vermouth are traded for lighter aperitifs. Dry vermouth works nicely here, as does Lillet Blanc and Suze, a gentian-based French liqueur. Both of the latter are used in our preferred White Negroni recipe below.

instructions.description: Stir all ingredients with ice, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel, or whatever suits your fancy.

name: Hot Toddy
description: Some call the Hot Toddy a cure for the common cold, some call it a sleep aid for fussy kids (over the age of 21, of course), and some call it the perfect solution to a chilly winter's eve. No matter what you decide to do with it, the Hot Toddy is a delicious, cozy classic that works like Sleepytime tea for grown-ups.The traditional Hot Toddy recipe is a mixture of a spirit (usually whiskey, rum, or brandy) with hot water and honey. Lemon and spices are always popular additions to this drink. You can also use tea instead of water for some additional flavor, so you've got options. But once you take a sip, the Hot Toddy should be both relaxing and invigorating, giving your body the delicious, boozy sustenance it needs to keep on going—whether you're fighting off a cold or just trying to stay warm on a cold winter's night.The below Hot Toddy recipe is a good one, but feel free to experiment to your heart's content.

ingredients.name: Whiskey (Single-Malt Scotch Preferred, But Bourbon, Rye, Or Irish Whiskey Also Work)
Honey, Simple Syrup, Demerara Syrup, Or Sugar (Adjust To Preference)
Lemon Twist Or Star Anise For Garnish

instructions.description: Add sweetener, lemon juice, and cloves to a mug. Fill partially with boiling water, stirring well until sweetener is nice and dissolved.
Add the whiskey. Fill rest of the way with boiling water, stirring well.
Stir and serve with your choice of garnish.

name: Pamplemousse  au  Poivre
description: The Pamplemousse au Poivre is a cocktail from esteemed San Francisco bartender H. Joseph Ehrmann. And in April of 2018, it was named the San Francisco World Spirits Competition's inaugural Cocktail of the Year.The Pamplemousse au Poivre is a Mezcal Sour with a unique kick. It's comprised of Mezcal Banhez, Giffard Pamplemousse Rose (a pink grapefruit liqueur), Marie Brizard Poivre a Sichuan (a Sichuan pepper liqueur), fresh lemon juice, and grapefruit bitters.Ehrmann's cocktail was chosen from a selection of mezcal-based cocktails in a blind judging by a panel of experts led by competition director Tony Abou-Ganim.If you can scare up those ingredients in your home bar, give it a whirl. The drink's certainly unique, but made with all commercially-available ingredients, it's doable. And it's something we'll be mixing up at Bevvy HQ whenever the urge for a mezcal-grapefruit-peppercorn cocktail hits.Hey, it happens.

ingredients.name: .5 Oz Marie Brizard Poivre De Sichuan

instructions.description: Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice.
Shake, then strain into a coupe.
Garnish with a grapefruit peel cone filled with pink peppercorns and affixed to the rim.

name: Rattlesnake Cocktail
description: "When we stumbled across a cocktail in the Savoy Cocktail Book with the claim that "it will either cure a rattlesnake bite, or kill rattlesnakes, or make you see them," we knew we had to try it. Dating back to the original 1930 publication of the bartending manual from London's Savoy Hotel, this tangy whiskey drink is just the right amount of sweet, sour, and straight-up booze. It's a spiteful but lovely little drink, with a smooth and frothy airiness provided by an egg white." - Saveur

instructions.description: Combine all ingredients except the bitters with ice and shake vigorously in a cocktail shaker until rich and frothy. Strain into a cocktail glass, shake 2 dashes of bitters on top, and serve.

name: Rusty Nail
description: The Rusty Nail is a simple, classic scotch cocktail that's been around in one form or another since at least 1937. It's made with scotch whisky and Drambuie, the renowned scotch-based honey liqueur. Humphrey Bogart and the Rat Pack made it hugely popular in the 1960s, and it's stuck around as a mainstay that you can get just about anywhere, from high-end cocktail join to dive bar.

instructions.description: Add scotch and Drambuie to an Old-Fashioned glass with ice and stir gently.
Garnish with a lemon twist and serve.

name: Washington Apple Shot
description: The Washington Apple Shot, despite the name, has really nothing to do with actual Washington apples at all.Instead, the Washington Apple shot is a popular club drink made with Canadian whisky (usually Crown Royal), sour apple liqueur (usually DeKuyper Sour Apple Pucker), cranberry juice, and an optional splash of lemon-lime soda. It can be served up or as a shot, and the Washington Apple cocktail is a fun, if somewhat unsophisticated drink, and likely enjoyed its peak popularity in the 1990s nightclub scene.The ingredients in this Washington Apple drink don't allow a lot of room for "classing up," as you probably don't want to waste your top-shelf stuff on a shooter, but you're welcome to give it a shot (ha!). Any Canadian whisky will do, but an American rye will also work, and you can use a nicer apple liqueur (or even an apple brandy) that doesn't have so much artificial sweetness.That said, the Washington Apple Shot might just be best the way it is—a party drink that doesn't try to be something it's not.

instructions.description: Add all ingredients except soda to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into a shot glass.
Add a splash of lemon-lime soda (optional), and serve.

name: Perfect Martini
description: The Perfect Martini is a twist on the classic Martini that adds sweet vermouth to the original cocktail's gin and dry vermouth. The result is a slightly sweeter, amber-colored drink.Although the word "perfect" may connote that this particular cocktail is better than others, the word is actually used to describe a drink that includes equal parts of sweet and dry vermouth. So a Perfect Manhattan is the same deal: base spirit (in this case whiskey) plus sweet and dry vermouth.When making a Perfect Martini, you can choose your preferred style of gin, but you can't go wrong with a London-dry like Beefeater or Tanqueray. It will stand up nicely alongside the herbal vermouths. Similarly, use quality vermouths, like those from Dolin, Noilly Prat, Cocchi, Carpano, and others. And be sure to keep the bottles refrigerated after they're opened, as vermouth oxidizes and eventually goes bad after about a month.Your resolute at-home bartending will result in a delicious, balanced cocktail that works equally well as an aperitif or a relaxing after-dinner drink by the fire.

instructions.description: Stir ingredients with ice, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist, and serve.

name: Jessica Rabbit
description: The Jessica Rabbit comes from Terra Mare, a handsome bar and restaurant in Fort Lauderdale, FL. To make this drink, they're starting with all your favorite margarita ingredients--tequila, Cointreau, and lime. From there, they've added orange juice, plus fresh carrot juice, cilantro simple syrup, and jalapeno for a savory vegetal note that pairs nicely with orange.Try mixing one up for yourself anytime tequila or fresh juice sounds good. And, really, when don't they?

instructions.description: Combine all ingredients with ice and shake.
Strain into a tall glass rimmed with kosher salt.
Garnish with a lime wheel

name: Amaretto Sour
description: The Amaretto Sour is a bit of a guilty pleasure drink, but as renowned Portland, Oregon bartender Jeffrey Morgenthaler (Clyde Common, Pépé le Moko) has proven, one that's not beyond saving. While the "classic" Amaretto Sour was simply made with two ounces of amaretto and a boatload of crappy sour mix, this modern version stands up as a pretty damn good cocktail.There are a few tricks to making your Amaretto Sour cocktail stand out from the crowd. First, as always, is the inclusion of fresh-squeezed lemon juice, and a bit of egg white for a nice, velvety texture. Then, because amaretto is pretty sweet on its own, you don't need to use very much simple syrup at all. But perhaps the most important modification to the Amaretto Sour recipe is the inclusion of cask-strength bourbon, which adds some much-needed kick and helps the amaretto stand up to the other ingredients.To watch Morgenthaler rant about the Amaretto Sour and make his own, check out this video from Small Screen Network.

instructions.description: Dry shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker (without ice).
Add ice, and shake well until chilled.
Strain over fresh ice into an Old-Fashioned glass.
Garnish with a cherry and a lemon twist.

name: Picante Paloma
description: This attractive number comes from Mexico City mixologist Mica Rousseau. Dubbed the Picante Paloma, it begins with tequila and grapefruit, similar to the classic Paloma. But rather than using grapefruit soda, we've got fresh grapefruit juice and sparkling water.Ancho Reyes Verde gives things a spicy poblano kick, while cilantro provides a fresh, herbal accent. Shake everything together and pour it into a tall glass, and you've got a refreshing cocktail perfect for patio sipping when the weather's warm.

ingredients.name: Fresh Ruby Red Pink Grapefruit Juice

instructions.description: Combine tequila, Ancho Reyes Verde, ruby red pink grapefruit juice, simple syrup and cilantro into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well.
Strain contents into a highball glass over fresh ice.
Top with San Pellegrino.
Garnish with a bouquet of cilantro.

name: Amaretto Stone Sour
description: The Amaretto Stone Sour—not to be confused with the Amaretto Sour—is a sweet and fruit-forward cocktail made with almond-flavored amaretto liqueur, simple syrup, fresh lemon juice, fresh orange juice, and a maraschino cherry as garnish. The addition of orange juice to this sour recipe is what differentiates the drink from the Amaretto Sour and gives it the "stone" prefix.The traditional recipe calls for sweet and sour mix, but as our preference is for using fresh ingredients, we've replaced the sour mix with the one-two punch of fresh lemon juice and simple syrup for this version of the Amaretto Stone Sour recipe. Combine your ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice, give everything a vigorous rattle, and you're ready to enjoy this fun drink.For a slightly different take with a very similar flavor profile, you can make your own sour mix by combining equal parts lime juice and lemon juice with simple syrup. Make a quantity to accommodate several rounds, and you'll have a batch ready to go for amaretto cocktails and other drinks. Or, if you don't feel like batching anything up, just add a half ounce of each juice to the cocktail rather than a full ounce of lemon.We can credit the inspiration for the Amaretto Stone Sour to bartender Tom Bullock, who first published the Stone Sour recipe in 1917's "The Ideal Bartender." His drink contained Old Tom gin, so the amaretto version is a departure from the original, but it has become a great drink in its own right.

instructions.description: Add the amaretto, simple syrup, lemon juice and orange juice into a shaker with ice, and shake well.
Strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice, garnish with the maraschino cherry, and serve.
Shake all ingredients without ice.
Add ice and shake again.
Double strain into a Nick and Nora glass and twist a lemon peel over the top.

name: Gin and Juice
description: The Gin and Juice is a simple cocktail that has stood the test of time. The drink has enjoyed such immense popularity that it's been forever immortalized in the eponymous hit song "Gin and Juice" from rap icon Snoop Dogg.We recommend using a decent dry gin for your Gin and Juice, as that will simply taste better. Something bold and not too delicate, so it can hold its own when mixed with the juice. And no need to get too fancy—just stay away from the bottom shelf plastic bottles. Fortunately, there are plenty of amazing gins available these days at reasonable cost. So you can save a few bucks while "sippin on Gin and Juice, laid back, with your mind on your money and your money on your mind."For the juice, OJ and grapefruit juice are both solid choices, and one of the more popular combos. But one of the best things about the Gin and Juice is that it's customizable to your tastes. So if you'd like to experiment with different juices, like cranberry juice, lemon juice, or lime juice, go for it. How to Make Gin and JuiceSnoop Dogg is too busy to be bothered with intricate cocktails that require lots of ingredients and garnishes. So don't worry about getting too fancy here. All you need to make the drink are gin, juice, a glass, and ice cubes. You will build the drink right in that glass, so there's no need to shake with ice, strain, muddle, or stir. See? Easy.This recipe calls for gin, orange juice, and grapefruit juice—fresh is always best if you don't mind scoring some real fruit. Some people like to add a little simple syrup to their drink, especially if they're using lemon juice or lime juice, which are more tart. But if you're using orange juice, you can probably exclude any additional sweetener. Others like to top it with soda water or tonic water. These are also perfectly fine ways to make a Gin and Juice. As you can tell, this recipe isn't too strict about the rules, so do what feels right and enjoy yourself. Just remember that, although the Gin and Juice tastes like a delicious punch, it's still packing plenty of alcohol

instructions.description: Add the gin and juices to a collins glass (or highball glass or double Old-Fashioned glass), and fill with ice.
Stir gently, optionally garnish with a lime, and serve.
Alternatively, use a single juice instead of two (just double-up your juice pour).

name: Tully Smash
description: The Tully Smash is a refreshing, easy-to-drink whiskey cocktail perfect for sipping during the warmer months. If you're a fan of Tullamore DEW, Whiskey Smashes or Mint Juleps, then this drink is for you. Mix up the ingredients, find a porch swing, and watch the world go by.

instructions.description: Add Tullamore D.E.W., lemon juice, and syrup to a shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into a julep cup over fresh pebble ice.
Garnish with lemon wedges, mint leaves, and cherries.

name: Slippery Nipple
description: The Slippery Nipple is a cheeky shot that combines Irish cream, Sambuca, and grenadine. It's sweet and creamy, with an anise flavor provided by the Sambuca. The shot is made by layering the Irish Cream on top of the Sambuca, and sinking the grenadine to the bottom, which creates a fun visual.The Slippery Nipple is popular at college bars and often with younger crowds, but if you like the taste of Irish cream and licorice, you'll likely enjoy it. And despite its interesting layered look, it's actually very easy to make at home.Why Is It Called the Slippery Nipple?Good question. Although the name is unfortunate, it belongs to the 1980s, an era in which many shots and cocktails were given lascivious names. Consider the Sex on the Beach (vodka, peach schnapps, OJ, cranberry) and the Silk Panties (vodka, peach schnapps).In this case, the layered effect of the drink, with a skin tone on top and a red drop of grenadine on the bottom, is meant to resemble the shot's namesake. In recent years, some bartenders have tried to recast these sexed up cocktails with new names. So, if you'd prefer to call this shot something else, it is occasionally referred to as the Licorice Ball.For a tweak to the Slippery Nipple, you can sub butterscotch schnapps in place of the Sambuca, and you get the Buttery Nipple.

instructions.description: Pour the Sambuca into a shot glass.
Layer the Irish cream on top of the Sambuca by slowly pouring it over the back of a bar spoon.
Add a drop of grenadine to the middle of the shot, and it will sink to the bottom.

name: Lychee Caipiroska
description: The Lychee Caipiroska is a lychee-flavored variation of the popular Caipirinha cocktail, made with vodka instead of cachaça. Caipiroska cocktails are built cocktails and fruity in nature, and the Lychee Caipiroska is a refreshing drink  using real lychees, allowing this delicate fruit's aroma and flavor to shine.

ingredients.name: Lime Juice (Juice From Half A Lime)

instructions.description: Muddle the lychees and sugar at the bottom of an old-fashioned rocks glass.
Add vodka, lime juice, and fill to top with crushed ice.
Stir well, and serve.
Optionally garnish with 1 lychee on a toothpick, laid flat on top of the glass edge.

name: Shirley Temple
description: A Shirley Temple "mocktail" is made with ginger ale and a splash of grenadine. Named after the American actress by the same name, the Shirley Temple is very similar to the Roy Rogers. It is rumored that Shirley Temple herself was not a fan of this drink.Shirley Temple cocktails are sometimes served to children as a non-alcoholic way for them to enjoy a cocktail when out with adults.

ingredients.name: Ginger Ale (Could Substitute With Lemon-Lime Soda)

instructions.description: Build in a highball glass. Add ginger ale over ice.
Top off with a splash of grenadine.
Garnish with a couple of cherries, and optionally a lemon slice.

name: Vieux Carré
description: The Vieux Carré is a classic New Orleans cocktail, named after the city's legendary French Quarter itself. It's made with equal parts rye whiskey, cognac, and sweet vermouth, alongside a touch of Bénédictine and both Peychaud's and Angostura bitters, making for a complex and intriguing flavor profile.The Vieux Carré is a staple of the famous Hotel Monteleone's Carousel Bar, a place known for its long list of famous literary guests, such as William Faulkner and Truman Capote—and also the host of the annual Tales of the Cocktail. Like the Sazerac, it's considered an essential New Orleans cocktail.

instructions.description: Add all ingredients except garnish to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled.
If garnishing with a cherry, place it in a chilled cocktail glass.
Strain the drink into the chilled cocktail glass and serve.

name: Harajuku
description: Japanese whisky is one of the finest liquids one can sip, but don't let that beguiling mix of smoothness and nuance sway you from adding a healthy pour to your next cocktail. Similar in structure and flavor to scotch, the very best examples of Japanese whisky aren't meant to be mixed. But there exist plenty of fine, easy-drinking expressions that work beautifully in cocktails, as evidenced by the lesson in synergy that is Harajuku.Hailing from the Dorsey, that stunning cocktail bar at the Venetian in Las Vegas, the Harajuku begins with a base of Nikka Coffey Grain Japanese whisky. Throw in a couple of bittersweet aperitifs—Gran Classico and Byrrh—and some chocolate bitters, and we've got ourselves a cocktail. The result is complex but exceedingly drinkable. You'll want to have one straight from the source, should you find yourself thirsty and in Vegas. Otherwise, try making one for yourself by following the recipe below.And should you require a more formal introduction to Japanes﻿e whisky, or a handy buying guide that details the best Japanese whisky under $100, well, we've got both.

instructions.description: Stir all ingredients with ice in a mixing glass.
Strain into an Old-Fashioned glass over one large ice cube.
Garnish with an orange twist and serve.

name: Pornstar Shooter
description: A Pornstar Shooter is an easy-to-make mixed drink with just two ingredients. What it lacks in subtlety (the name is a little rough, as are the ingredients), it makes up for in simplicity and fun.Though this drink can be extended into a full cocktail by increasing the portions of Blue Curacao and raspberry liqueur, it's typically served in a shot glass and downed in one go. The drink is traditionally made with Sour Puss raspberry liqueur, the best selling liqueur brand in Canada. Sour Puss makes a variety of different expressions, including peach, watermelon, grape, and tangerine. So if you like the Pornstar Shooter, you can experiment by substituting other flavored liqueurs in for the raspberry. Of course, if you can't find this particular brand, you can also substitute whatever raspberry liqueur is available on shelves near you. The end result should be very similar.The next time you're in the mood for some fun party shots, follow the cocktail recipe below to learn how to make a Pornstar Shooter.(Note that this drink is not the same as the Porn Star Martini, which is made with vodka, passion fruit, lime, vanilla syrup, and sparkling wine.)

instructions.description: Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice, then strain into a shot glass.
Alternatively, the Pornstar Shooter can be made by pouring the raspberry liqueur directly on top of the Curacao in the glass for a layered effect.

name: Le Cidre Royale
description: On May 19, 2018, Prince Harry weds Meghan Markle at Windsor Castle in England. It's kind of a big deal, if you're into that sort of thing. We think any celebration is a fine excuse for a cocktail, and if that cocktail fits the theme... even better.Le Cidre Royale is a drink fit for the grandest of viewing parties, though it'll taste just as good on your couch with a slice of pizza. Consisting of Stella Artois Cidre, gin, rosé, and elderflower liqueur, it's a bubbly, refreshing, easy-drinking cocktail for toasting to the royal couple. And because the duo's wedding cake is an elderflower-lemon number, you're really adhering to the theme.The drink itself is very easy to make, and can be concocted right in your glass. Just be sure that your Cidre and rosé are plenty cold before pouring.

instructions.description: Pour ingredients into a champagne flute.
Twist a lemon over the glass, gently rub it around the rim, and discard.

name: Champagne Jello Shots
description: Things don't get much more festive than Champagne Jello Shots. This simple, three-part drink (well, it's really more of a snack) is easy to make and fun to serve. You just need your favorite flavor of Jello, Champagne, and water, and you're all set.And because Champagne Jello shots are a low-alcohol concoction—in stark contrast to the average Jello shot which includes vodka or even Everclear as the base—you can have a few without fading too quickly.So follow the below recipe, and impress your guests with a batch of Champagne Jello Shots for your next party. They're a memorable treat.

ingredients.name: Package Jello (Orange, Grape, Or Whatever You Prefer)

instructions.description: Mix the jello powder with boiling water until fully dissolved (refer to the instructions on the box as necessary).
Let the mixture sit for a while, and cool to room temperature.
Slowly add the champagne to the mixture, stirring evenly.
Pour the mixture into ice cube trays, and refrigerate until set.
To remove the jello, dip the trays in hot water for about 5 seconds, then run a knife around the sides of the jello to separate it from the tray.
Place all of your jello cubes onto a serving plate or into a large bowl, and serve with tongs.

name: Zombie
description: The Zombie is a tropical drink that was reportedly concocted by legendary tiki proprietor Don the Beachcomber in the late 1930s as a hangover cure. In reality, it's probably created a lot more hangovers than it's cured, considering most recipes include a full four ounces of rum (one of which is 151 proof).The classic Donn Beach Zombie recipe uses something known as "Donn's Mix," which is basically just a blend of cinnamon simple syrup and grapefruit juice. To make it, heat 0.5 cup water, 0.5 cup sugar, and two crushed cinnamon sticks in a small saucepan. Once it has cooled completely, combine the syrup with 2 cups fresh grapefruit juice.The Zombie is a cocktail that should probably come with a warning label: we rarely recommend having more than one, and three is getting into alcohol poisoning territory. So, all joking aside, take it easy on this one.

instructions.description: Add all ingredients except 151 and garnish to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Alternatively, you can blend everything in a blender with a cup of ice to make this a frozen drink.
Strain into a Highball glass or Hurricane glass over fresh ice.
Float the 151 rum on top by pouring over a spoon.
Garnish and serve.

name: Blood and Sand
description: The Blood and Sand is a cocktail that always inspires debate among bartenders. Named for Rudolph Valentino's 1922 bullfighter movie Blood and Sand, it consists of a fairly perplexing combination of scotch, sweet vermouth, Cherry Heering, and orange juice in equal parts.Though it certainly sits among the classics, the Blood and Sand isn't exactly a well-balanced drink as originally written. Many modern bartenders have tweaked it, adding and removing ingredients here and there to find the sweet spot. But if you're looking for the unadulterated recipe, look no further.

instructions.description: Add all ingredients except garnish to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange twist and serve.

name: Blue Hawaiian
description: The Blue Hawaiian is a vibrant, tropical cocktail that can either be served on the rocks or blended. It's made with white rum, pineapple juice, blue curaçao (a blue-colored orange liqueur, hence the name and neon hue), and cream of coconut, and while that isn't the most subtle flavor combination in the world, it's certainly one that goes great with the beach.The Blue Hawaiian dates back to the mid-20th century, and falls squarely under the umbrella of old-school tiki drinks. It likely takes its name from the 1961 Elvis Presley flick Blue Hawaii.

ingredients.name: Pineapple Slice And Cherry (Optional) For Garnish

instructions.description: Add all ingredients except garnish to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into a highball glass over fresh ice, garnish with a pineapple slice and cherry, and serve.
Alternatively, add all ingredients except garnish to a blender with one cup of ice and blend until smooth.
Pour into a highball glass, garnish with a pineapple slice and cherry, and serve.

name: Green Iguana
description: The Green Iguana is a cocktail composed of tequila, lime juice, simple syrup, and Midori, a melon liqueur that provides the drink's bright green hue. It's fruity, tart, and eye-catching. Mix up a Green Iguana for yourself by following the below recipe. And for best results, use fresh lime juice to counter the Midori's sweetness.

instructions.description: Salt rim of a chilled cocktail glass.
Shake all ingredients well (except salt) in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Strain into the cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Frozen Margarita
description: This isn’t exactly the most out-there Margarita variation, given that a lot of people don’t know there’s such thing as a non-frozen Margarita, but it deserves some love regardless. Perfectly refreshing for those extra-hot summer afternoons.

instructions.description: Place salt in a saucer. Rub rim of a cocktail glass with lime wedge and dip glass into salt to coat rim thoroughly. Reserve lime.
Pour tequila, triple sec, lime juice, and crushed ice into a blender.
Blend well at high speed.
Pour into a cocktail glass.

name: Cereal Killer
description: One of the best things about childhood was definitely the cereal. Starting your day with something delicious and sugary before parents really understood the dangers of high-sugar diets and empty carbs. Ah... to be young. Now, the best way to feel that kind of visceral satisfaction is usually by enjoying a good drink.Fortunately, the Cereal Killer combines the two into a nostalgia-inducing cocktail. Hailing from the Andaz Scottsdale Resort & Spa, it's merging Ron Zacapa Rum with Fruity Pebbles, milk, peach schnapps, and simple syrup. It's an eye-catching cocktail that's perfectly acceptable to pair with breakfast. And while you can't go back to being a kid again, well, you can sort of drink like one.

instructions.description: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into a coupe.
Garnish with Fruity Pebbles.

name: Velvet Fire
description: The Velvet Fire drink was introduced in January 2021 as a partnership between Disaronno Velvet and Jack Daniel’s Tennessee Fire. It blends the creamy hints of toffee and almond from the Disaronno with the warming cinnamon-whiskey notes of the Jack Daniel's. The simple drink is made in a 2:1 ratio and can be scaled up or down as needed. If you want a larger drink, try two ounces of Disaronno Velvet and one ounce of Jack Daniel’s Tennessee Fire over ice. If you want to consume the Velvet Fire as a shot, just shake together smaller portions of each and strain the contents into a shot glass.Launched in 2020, Disaronno Velvet is 17% ABV and has a floral character of almonds alongside chocolate and vanilla, all while providing that trademark amaretto flavor you expect from Disaronno. Jack Daniel’s Tennessee Fire launched globally in 2016 and is one of the best-selling flavored whiskeys in the world. It combines the brand's flagship Jack Daniel’s Old No. 7 Tennessee Whiskey with a proprietary cinnamon liqueur and is bottled at 35% ABV.To promote the cocktail, the two bottles are sold together nationwide as a Velvet Fire combo pack, or you can purchase them individually. Either way, the duo can be combined into this simple and tasty drink.

instructions.description: Combine Disaronno Velvet and Jack Daniel’s Tennessee Fire over ice in a rocks glass.
Alternatively, shake the ingredients together with ice and serve as a shot.

name: Spiced Carrot Margarita
description: The Spiced Carrot Margarita is a fresh, springtime Margarita variation made with fresh carrot juice, spicy chili-infused tequila and Ancho Reyes liqueur, and some mezcal for a bit of smoke. The result is a complex and earthy drink with plenty of kick, and it's sure to bring some welcome variety to your next cocktail party south of the border.

ingredients.name: Salt And Lime Wheel For Garnish

instructions.description: Rim an Old-Fashioned glass with salt.
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into the salt-rimmed Old-Fashioned glass over fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel and serve.

name: Dry Manhattan
description: You know the Manhattan? Well, this is a Dry Manhattan. The chief difference being that this iteration of the classic cocktail calls for dry vermouth instead of sweet. The change makes a big difference, lending the cocktail a more herbaceous and floral note while dialing back slightly on the richness. The Dry Manhattan is a nice change of pace when you're looking for a spirit-forward whiskey cocktail that's not quite a Manhattan, but still in the ballpark.

instructions.description: Stir well in a mixing glass filled with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a lemon peel.

name: Cuba Libre
description: The Cuba Libre is, for all intents and purposes, simply a Rum and Coke with a lime squeezed into it. This simple addition rounds out the flavor profile nicely, though, and makes it obvious how such a basic cocktail can be a classic. We recommend using either a white rum or a gold rum, as anything more subtle will get lost in the cola.The Cuba Libre (meaning "free Cuba") takes its name from a popular slogan of the Spanish-American War, which was fought primarily on Cuban soil. Americans, taken by the romance of Cuban revolutionaries who sought independence from Spain, adopted the phrase during the war, and the drink followed shortly after.

ingredients.name: Lime Wedge Or Wheel For Garnish

instructions.description: Squeeze one half of a lime into a highball glass filled with ice (alternatively, add 0.5 oz of fresh lime juice).
Add rum, then fill with cola and stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge or wheel and serve.

name: Yellow Jacket
description: The Yellow Jacket is a modern-classic cocktail that comes from Jason Kosmas and Dushan Zaric, the team behind NYC's Employees Only bar. It appeared in their book, Speakeasy, and is named for the yellow jacket wasps that inhabit agave farms and tequila distilleries.The Yellow Jacket combines reposado tequila (originally Partida Reposado), Yellow Chartreuse, St-Germain, and orange bitters. It's strong, floral, herbal, and bittersweet, packing a whole lot of well-balanced flavor into the glass.

instructions.description: Stir all ingredients with ice, then strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

name: Fernet and Coke
description: Strangely enough, the Fernet and Coke (a fairly self-explanatory cocktail) is one of the most popular drinks in Argentina. They even wrote a whole song about Fernet and Coke, which, fair warning, is pretty terrible. That said, the drink itself is fantastic despite its simplicity. The cola flavors blend well with the complexities of the Fernet, softening what can otherwise be a somewhat overpowering liqueur.

instructions.description: Add Fernet to a Highball or Collins glass with ice.
Fill with Coke.
Garnish with a lemon twist (optional) and serve.

name: Strawberry Daiquiri
description: The Strawberry Daiquiri is perhaps the most popular variation of the Frozen Daiquiri (which itself is a riff on the classic Daiquiri), and when done right it can be a deliciously refreshing summertime treat and a crowd pleaser on a hot day.What's in a Strawberry Daiquiri?The ingredients for this Strawberry Daiquiri recipe starts off much like a basic Frozen Daiquiri, with white rum as the base alcohol, simple syrup as the sweetener, and fresh lime juice, which balances everything out. We then add fresh strawberries and ice cubes, throw it all in a blender, and blend until you have a nice smooth texture.There's no need to use artificial flavorings or pre-made strawberry mix. We cannot over-emphasize the importance of using fresh fruit and fresh juice for a superior flavor profile—it simply tastes better. Much, much better.After blending, pour the finished beverage into a Margarita glass. Yes, the glassware seems strange considering this drink is a Daiquiri, not a Margarita, but that's the way things go sometimes. If you want to switch things up, or don't have the requisite glassware on hand, a cocktail glass or coupe will also do nicely. Then all that's left to do is garnish your creation with an extra strawberry, and serve. Pro tip: For the best results, chill the glassware in your freezer ahead of time until the glass is nice and frosty.See our recipe card below for the list of simple ingredients and proportions. Or, try this slight variation.The Muddled Strawberry Daiquiri VariationWhile the frozen Strawberry Daiquiri is probably the most popular variety, you can also make a muddled Strawberry Daiquiri just as easily. You'll need a shaker and muddler, but you can skip the blender entirely.Start by adding the strawberries, lime juice, rum, and simple syrup to a cocktail shaker, then use your muddler to mash it all up. Fill the shaker halfway with ice and shake well until chilled, then strain into your chilled glassware.Both methods are delicious, so go ahead and try both to see which you prefer.

instructions.description: Add the rum, simple syrup, lime juice and strawberries into a blender with ice, and blend until smooth.
Pour into a Margarita glass (or other glass).
Garnish with a strawberry and serve.

name: Dry Negroni Cocktail
description: The Dry Negroni is a simple variation on the original Negroni recipe. Rather than sweet vermouth, this version subs in dry vermouth. The result: a somewhat drier but still very herbal and aromatic cocktail that provides a fun departure from the classic when you want to mix things up.

instructions.description: Pour Campari, gin and vermouth into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
Stir well, garnish with a twist of lemon, and serve.

name: Gin-Gin Mule
description: The Gin Gin Mule is quite simply a Moscow Mule with gin instead of vodka. It's a nice little twist on the classic Moscow Mule recipe that is as refreshing and as delicious as the original.The Moscow Mule cocktail was devised by Smirnoff vodka in collaboration with the Cock and Bull Tavern in Los Angeles, the latter having branded a ginger beer it was wondering what to do with (read more about the history of the Moscow Mule). The drink, along with its' iconic copper mug, catapulted to immense popularity and inspired numerous variations.Being that gin and ginger beer have a long history as favorites in the UK, it was only natural that they'd eventually end up together in a delicious riff—named quite appropriately as the Gin Gin Mule.

ingredients.name: Gin (Preferably A London Dry Like Beefeater Or Tanqueray)

instructions.description: Combine the juice and mint in a copper mug or Collins glass.
Muddle the mint, then fill the glass with ice and add the gin.
Stir until chilled.
Top with ginger beer, and garnish with a sprig of mint and a piece of lime.

name: Watermelon Margarita
description: One of the signature drinks Jess and I had served at our wedding. Amazing any time of the year, but definitely fits in the summer best.

instructions.description: Prepare glass with sugar or salt rim with ice
Shake all ingredients over ice
Double strain into prepared glass over ice
Garnish with watermelon slice or anything else you may have that fits

name: Sidecar
description: The Sidecar is a Prohibition-era classic with a nice balance of citrus and sweet, making it a perennial favorite. The exact origin of the Sidecar is unclear, and as a cocktail it definitely demands some experimentation with the proportions. Most ratios are equally valid (don't tell anyone we said that...), but this recipe is the one we've found most reliably delicious.

instructions.description: Run a slice of lemon around the rim of a cocktail glass, then place the glass rim-down in a plate with sugar. Give it a little twist to make sure the rim is evenly coated.
Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into your sugar-rimmed cocktail glass.

name: Hennessy and Soda
description: A Hennessy and Soda is a simple two-ingredient cocktail that combines... you guessed it: Hennessy cognac and soda water. It's typically served in a Collins Glass over ice. The Hennessy and Soda is a Highball, which is a category of drinks wherein a spirit and a non-alcoholic mixer are served in a tall glass with ice. The most common Highball is the Scotch & Soda, so here you're essentially just replacing scotch with cognac. Follow the cocktail recipe below to learn how to make a Hennessy and Soda for yourself.

instructions.description: Pour the Hennessy cognac into a collins or other tall glass 3/4 filled with ice cubes. Add cherry coke, stir lightly, and serve.

name: Hennessy and Coke
description: A Hennessy and Coke is a simple two-ingredient cocktail that's comprised of exactly what it sounds like: Hennessy cognac and Coca-Cola. The liquor and soda work nicely together and create a refreshing, easy-to-make drink that you can make at home or order in just about any bar in the world.Follow the cocktail recipe below to learn how to make a Hennessy and Coke.

instructions.description: Build over ice in a Collins glass or an Old-fashioned glass.
Serve.

name: Lemon Drop
description: The Lemon Drop cocktail (sometimes known as a Lemon Drop Martini, but that's pretty misleading since it doesn't have much to do with a Martini) is a sweet, citrusy drink that's loosely based on the classic Sidecar.Be sure to squeeze the lemon juice fresh, and if you want to class it up a bit you can use Cointreau instead of a cheaper triple sec. You also don't need to rim the glass with sugar if you want a less overly-sweet drink, but hey, half the fun is having the Lemon Drop for dessert.

ingredients.name: Sugar And Lemon Twist For Garnish

instructions.description: Coat the rim of a chilled cocktail glass with sugar.
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into the chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist and serve.

name: Air Mail
description: Inspired by the French 75, the Air Mail is an effervescent, rum-based cocktail that combines rum, lime juice, and honey syrup topped with champagne and Angostura bitters. While the origin of the name is murky—it may have been named after the modern delivery method for mail—the Air Mail cocktail first appeared in print in the 1949 edition of Handbook for Hosts published by Esquire magazine.

ingredients.name: Honey Syrup (1 Part Honey To 1 Part Water)

instructions.description: Combine rum, lime juice, honey syrup and ice in a cocktail shaker, and shake vigorously.
Strain into a chilled coupe, and top with champagne.
Add bitters to the surface of the cocktail, using an eye-dropper, if you've got one.
Garnish with a mint leaf.

name: Americano
description: The Americano cocktail originated at Gaspare Campari's bar in Milan, Italy in the 1860s, and likely gained its name because of its popularity amongst American tourists. It's made with Campari, sweet vermouth, and differs from the slightly older Milano-Torino only in the addition of soda water. James Bond ordered one in the short story From a View to a Kill, giving it some serious cool-factor, and it's great for a hot summer day or sitting at an Italian café with a good book.

instructions.description: Pour all ingredients into a highball or Collins glass over ice, and stir gently.
Garnish with orange twist.

name: Negroni Alla Verbena
description: The Negroni is an all-weather cocktail, as apt at providing summertime refreshment as it is at fortifying you against a cold winter's night. Such is the versatile nature of this classic three-part drink. But mix a little verbena into that gin... and now you've got a version that's perfect for spring.The Negroni Alla Verbena you see here hails from Monastero Santa Rosa, a 17th-century monastery turned luxury boutique hotel and spa that opened in 2012. It's a fine place to spend your next vacation, in part because it's located on Italy's Amalfi Coast, but also because they're mixing up some serious cocktails. In making those drinks, Bar Manager Ivan Stankovic pulls ingredients straight from the property's garden, so the herbs and fruits you'll be imbibing are as fresh as they can get. In this case, he's working with some verbena-infused gin. And you can, too, by following the recipe below.

instructions.description: Verbena-infused gin: infuse one bottle of gin with 1/8 cup of verbena leaves. Store in refrigerator at 40° F for 30 minutes. Filter out the leaves.
Verbena soda: cook 1/4 cup of verbena leaves in one liter of distilled water for 20 minutes at 140° F. Let cool, then pour into a soda siphon and store in the refrigerator.
Pour the ingredients into a chilled Old-Fashioned glass with ice cubes, and stir gently.
Top with a splash of verbena soda.
Garnish with verbena leaves and lemon peels.

name: Silk Panties
description: The Silk Panties is a fun shot that combines vodka and peach schnapps. While today it's a relatively obscure drink that has been mostly relegated to college bars, it was named “Drink of the Year” by Bartender Magazine in 1986. Yes, it's from the '80s, the same decade that brought us a slew of other drinks with provocative names.The Silk Panties can be served as a shot or enjoyed more slowly as a cocktail. This recipe, when shaken with ice, makes enough for two shots. If you'd like to drink it as a cocktail, simply strain the contents into a cocktail glass and garnish with an optional peach slice.For a simple riff on this drink, add a dash of cranberry juice, and you get the Pink Silk Panties (also called the Woo Woo). This version is typically served up in a cocktail glass.

instructions.description: Shake vodka and peach schnapps with ice until chilled.
Strain into two shot glasses, or serve up as a cocktail.

name: Black Manhattan
description: The Black Manhattan is a simple Manhattan variation that was invented at famed San Francisco bar Bourbon & Branch by bartender Todd Smith. It replaces the sweet vermouth with Amaro Averna, a classic Sicilian amaro that's known for its bittersweet herbal and caramel flavors. The Black Manhattan cocktail has become something of a modern classic, inspiring a number of related variations.

instructions.description: Place the cherry in a chilled cocktail glass.
Add all ingredients (except garnish) to a mixing glass with ice and stir until chilled.
Strain into the cocktail glass and serve.

name: Blue Margarita
description: The Blue Margarita subs out the traditional Cointreau for another orange liqueur, curaçao, albeit one with a blue hue. The result is similar to the classic cocktail, but with a vibrant blue color that'll turn heads.

instructions.description: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lime juice, and dip the rim in coarse salt.
Shake tequila, blue curacao, and lime juice with ice.
Strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.

name: Original Blue Hawaii
description: The Blue Hawaiian is a well-known cocktail that you'll find at swim-up bars and in tropical locales all over the world. But the version most often served today (white rum, pineapple juice, blue curaçao, cream of coconut) is a riff on the original Blue Hawaii recipe, which was created by bartender Harry Yee at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in 1957. Yeah, it's a little confusing.According to drinks author Cheryl Charming, Yee concocted the Blue Hawaii recipe when Bols asked him to make a cocktail with their blue curaçao, which was a new product at the time.The Blue Hawaii recipe seen here includes vodka, Puerto Rican rum, blue curaçao, pineapple, lemon juice, and simple syrup, and it skips the cream of coconut. Overall, it's a much different drink that is a bit boozier, less sweet and creamy, and more balanced from the addition of fresh lemon. So, the next time you want to whip up a tropical blue drink, try Harry Yee's original Blue Hawaii recipe on for size.

instructions.description: Fill a 12-ounce Hurricane glass with ice.
Add all ingredients, then stir to mix and add water dilution.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and orchid, and serve by saying “aloha.”

name: Oriental Cocktail
description: According to "The Savoy Cocktail Book" by Harry Craddock, the Oriental Cocktail recipe's origin story can be traced back to 1924, when an American engineer nearly died of fever while working in the Philippines. To show appreciation to the doctor who saved his life, he shared the recipe for this very cocktail.The traditional recipe calls for "blended whiskey," which in this case translates to rye. From there, you're enlisting sweet vermouth, triple sec (Cointreau is a good choice), and fresh lime juice, which adds some round refreshment to the otherwise boozy drink.

instructions.description: Shake all ingredients with ice.
Strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

name: Turkey and Sage Cocktail
description: While there's not actually any turkey in this cocktail (I'd probably have to drink a few too many of something else before I tried that), the name and the pumpkin butter (recipe here) scream Thanksgiving. This is a fun recipe for entertaining over the holidays, but I love it all year round!

ingredients.name: Ounce Lemon Juice, From One Lemon

instructions.description: Reserve one sage leaf for garnish and muddle the rest gently in a cocktail shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice. Add bourbon, pumpkin butter, lemon juice, and bitters. Shake until chilled, about 20 seconds.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass and float a sage leaf on top for garnish.

name: Man O' War
description: The Man o' War cocktail is named for one of the most legendary racehorses of all time, who won numerous high-profile races in the years following WWI. The standard recipe calls for a full ounce of orange curaçao or triple sec (Grand Marnier is a good choice), but we felt that was a bit too sweet considering the rest of the ingredients and halved it.Like any good horse-racing cocktail the Man o' War features bourbon at the forefront. Be sure to use fresh lemon juice, as that gives it the citrusy kick it needs to cut through the orange liqueur and vermouth.

ingredients.name: Orange Or Lemon Twist For Garnish

instructions.description: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with an orange or lemon twist and serve.

name: Maker's Mark and Coke
description: The Maker's Mark and Coke is a simple two-ingredient cocktail that's comprised of... Maker's Mark and Coke. It's a popular call at bars for anyone who wants to specify the bourbon that goes into their Bourbon and Coke. Maker's Mark is a great addition to cola, because it features a wheat-heavy grain recipe that is sweeter than many other bourbons on the market.To make one for yourself, aim for about a 3:1 ratio of Makers to Coke and serve your drink on the rocks.

instructions.description: Build over ice in a Collins glass or an Old-fashioned glass.
Serve.

name: Ancho Gimlet
description: The Gimlet is a classic cocktail comprised of gin, lime and sugar. But what happens when you add a spicy green poblano liqueur to the mix? Well, you get the Ancho Gimlet (ancho simply meaning a poblano that's been dried). It's supplied via Ancho Reyes Verde, the peppery Mexican liqueur that adds notes of roasted poblano to anything it touches.Toss in a little fresh cucumber, and you've got a festive take on the Gimlet that gives the drink a welcome kick without sacrificing refreshment.

instructions.description: Shake all ingredients with ice to chill and dilute.
Strain through a fine mesh strainer into a coupe.
Garnish with a cucumber wheel.
Add all ingredients (except garnish) to a blender and blend at low speed for five seconds, then blend at high speed until firm.
Pour contents into a cocktail glass, garnish with the strawberry, and serve.
